When in debug mode, the DMA continues to operate.
When in debug mode, the DMA stalls the start of a new channel. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when the system exits debug mode or the EDBG bit is cleared.
Fixed priority arbitration is used for channel selection .
Round robin arbitration is used for channel selection .
Normal operation
Any error causes the HALT bit to set. Subsequently, all service requests are ignored until the HALT bit is cleared.
Normal operation
Stall the start of any new channels. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when this bit is cleared.
A minor loop channel link made to itself goes through channel arbitration before being activated again.

A minor loop channel link made to itself does not go through channel arbitration before being activated again. Upon minor loop completion, the channel activates again if that channel has a minor loop channel link enabled and the link channel is itself. This effectively applies the minor loop offsets and restarts the next minor loop.
Disabled. TCDn.word2 is defined as a 32-bit NBYTES field.

Enabled. TCDn.word2 is redefined to include individual enable fields, an offset field, and the NBYTES field. The individual enable fields allow the minor loop offset to be applied to the source address, the destination address, or both. The NBYTES field is reduced when either offset is enabled.
Normal operation

Cancel the remaining data transfer in the same fashion as the CX bit. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The ECX bit clears itself after the cancel is honored. In addition to cancelling the transfer, ECX treats the cancel as an error condition, thus updating the Error Status register (DMAx_ES) and generating an optional error interrupt.
Normal operation

Cancel the remaining data transfer. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The CX bit clears itself after the cancel has been honored. This cancel retires the channel normally as if the minor loop was completed.
No destination bus error
The last recorded error was a bus error on a destination write
No source bus error
The last recorded error was a bus error on a source read
No scatter/gather configuration error

The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLASTSGA field. This field is checked at the beginning of a scatter/gather operation after major loop completion if TCDn_CSR[ESG] is enabled. TCDn_DLASTSGA is not on a 32 byte boundary.
No NBYTES/CITER configuration error

The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_NBYTES or TCDn_CITER fields. TCDn_NBYTES is not a multiple of TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE] and TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE], or TCDn_CITER[CITER] is equal to zero, or TCDn_CITER[ELINK] is not equal to TCDn_BITER[ELINK]
No destination offset configuration error
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field. TCDn_DOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].
No destination address configuration error
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field. TCDn_DADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].
No source offset configuration error
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field. TCDn_SOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].
No source address configuration error.
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field. TCDn_SADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

BitField.name: ERRCHN
BitField.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number

Enum.description: No channel priority error
The last recorded error was a configuration error in the channel priorities . Channel priorities are not unique.
No canceled transfers
The last recorded entry was a canceled transfer by the error cancel transfer input

BitField.name: VLD
BitField.description: Logical OR of all ERR status bits

Enum.description: No ERR bits are set.
At least one ERR bit is set indicating a valid error exists that has not been cleared.

Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.
The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.
The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.
The half-point interrupt is enabled.
The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.
The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.
The current channel's TCD is normal format.
The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.
The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.
No eDMA engine stalls.
eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.
eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.
The channel is not explicitly started.
The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.
The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.
The half-point interrupt is enabled.
The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.
The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.
The current channel's TCD is normal format.
The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.
The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.
The current channel's TCD is normal format.
The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

Single entry buffer is enabled.

Enable prefetches in response to data references.

Cache data references.

Independent LRU with ways [0-2] for ifetches, [3] for data

128 bits

BitField.name: MGSTAT0
BitField.description: Memory Controller Command Completion Status Flag

Enum.description: No protection violation detected
Protection violation detected
No access error detected
Access error detected
No collision error detected
Collision error detected
Flash command in progress
Flash command has completed
No suspend requested
Suspend the current Erase Flash Sector command execution.
No request or request complete

Request to: run the Erase All Blocks command, verify the erased state, program the security byte in the Flash Configuration Field to the unsecure state, and release MCU security by setting the FSEC[SEC] field to the unsecure state.
Read collision error interrupt disabled
Read collision error interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever a flash memory read collision error is detected (see the description of FSTAT[RDCOLERR]).
Command complete interrupt disabled
Command complete interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FSTAT[CCIF] flag is set.
MCU security status is secure.
MCU security status is secure.
MCU security status is unsecure. (The standard shipping condition of the flash memory module is unsecure.)
MCU security status is secure.
Freescale factory access granted
Freescale factory access denied
Freescale factory access denied
Freescale factory access granted
Mass erase is enabled
Mass erase is enabled
Mass erase is disabled
Mass erase is enabled
Backdoor key access disabled
Backdoor key access disabled (preferred KEYEN state to disable backdoor key access)
Backdoor key access enabled
Backdoor key access disabled

BitField.name: MAXMB
BitField.description: Number Of The Last Message Buffer

Enum.description: Format A: One full ID (standard and extended) per ID Filter Table element.
Format B: Two full standard IDs or two partial 14-bit (standard and extended) IDs per ID Filter Table element.
Format C: Four partial 8-bit Standard IDs per ID Filter Table element.
Format D: All frames rejected.
Abort disabled.

BitField.name: IRMQ
BitField.description: Individual Rx Masking And Queue Enable

Enum.description: Individual Rx masking and queue feature are disabled. For backward compatibility with legacy applications, the reading of C/S word locks the MB even if it is EMPTY.
Individual Rx masking and queue feature are enabled.
Self reception enabled.
Self reception disabled.
FlexCAN is not enabled to enter low-power mode when Doze mode is requested.
FlexCAN is enabled to enter low-power mode when Doze mode is requested.
FlexCAN uses the unfiltered Rx input to detect recessive to dominant edges on the CAN bus.
FlexCAN uses the filtered Rx input to detect recessive to dominant edges on the CAN bus.
FlexCAN is not in a low-power mode.
FlexCAN is in a low-power mode.
TWRNINT and RWRNINT bits are zero, independent of the values in the error counters.
TWRNINT and RWRNINT bits are set when the respective error counter transitions from less than 96 to greater than or equal to 96.
FlexCAN Self Wake Up feature is disabled.
FlexCAN Self Wake Up feature is enabled.
FlexCAN is in User mode. Affected registers allow both Supervisor and Unrestricted accesses.
FlexCAN is in Supervisor mode. Affected registers allow only Supervisor access. Unrestricted access behaves as though the access was done to an unimplemented register location.

FlexCAN in Freeze mode, prescaler stopped.
No reset request.
Resets the registers affected by soft reset.

Wake Up Interrupt is enabled.

Enters Freeze mode if the FRZ bit is asserted.
Rx FIFO not enabled.
Rx FIFO enabled.
Not enabled to enter Freeze mode.
Enabled to enter Freeze mode.

Disable the FlexCAN module.

Lowest number buffer is transmitted first.

Timer Sync feature enabled

BitField.name: BUF5I
BitField.description: Buffer MB5 Interrupt Or "Frames available in Rx FIFO"

The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception.
The corresponding buffer has no occurrence of successfully completed transmission or reception.
The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception.

BitField.name: EACEN
BitField.description: Entire Frame Arbitration Field Comparison Enable For Rx Mailboxes

Enum.description: Rx Mailbox filter's IDE bit is always compared and RTR is never compared despite mask bits.
Enables the comparison of both Rx Mailbox filter's IDE and RTR bit with their corresponding bits within the incoming frame. Mask bits do apply.
Remote Response Frame is generated.
Remote Request Frame is stored.
Matching starts from Rx FIFO and continues on Mailboxes.
Matching starts from Mailboxes and continues on Rx FIFO.
Bus Off Done interrupt disabled.
Bus Off Done interrupt enabled.
If ESR2[VPS] is asserted, the ESR2[LPTM] is not an inactive Mailbox.
If ESR2[VPS] is asserted, there is at least one inactive Mailbox. LPTM content is the number of the first one.
Contents of IMB and LPTM are invalid.
Contents of IMB and LPTM are valid.
The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."
The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

BitField.name: TIME_STAMP
BitField.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

BitField.name: IDE
BitField.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

BitField.name: SRR
BitField.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

BitField.name: EXT
BitField.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: STD
BitField.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

Contents of IMB and LPTM are valid.

BitField.name: TIME_STAMP
BitField.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

BitField.name: IDE
BitField.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

BitField.name: SRR
BitField.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

BitField.name: EXT
BitField.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: STD
BitField.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).
TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

RegisterGroup.name: PWMA
RegisterGroup.description: Pulse Width Modulator with nano edge placement

Enum.description: The IPBus clock is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.
EXT_CLK is used as the clock for the local prescaler and counter.
Submodule 0's clock (AUX_CLK) is used as the source clock for the local prescaler and counter. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the clock to logic 0.
The local RELOAD signal is used to reload registers.
The master RELOAD signal (from submodule 0) is used to reload registers. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the RELOAD signal to logic 0.

BitField.name: FORCE_SEL
BitField.description: This read/write bit determines the source of the FORCE OUTPUT signal for this submodule.

Enum.description: The local force signal, CTRL2[FORCE], from this submodule is used to force updates.
The master force signal from submodule 0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.
The local reload signal from this submodule is used to force updates without regard to the state of LDOK.
The master reload signal from submodule0 is used to force updates if LDOK is set. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.
The local sync signal from this submodule is used to force updates.
The master sync signal from submodule0 is used to force updates. This setting should not be used in submodule0 as it will hold the FORCE OUTPUT signal to logic 0.
The external force signal, EXT_FORCE, from outside the PWM module causes updates.
The external sync signal, EXT_SYNC, from outside the PWM module causes updates.
Initialization from a FORCE_OUT event is disabled.
Initialization from a FORCE_OUT event is enabled.
Local sync (PWM_X) causes initialization.

Master reload from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0. The submodule counter will only reinitialize when a master reload occurs.
Master sync from submodule 0 causes initialization. This setting should not be used in submodule 0 as it will force the INIT signal to logic 0.
EXT_SYNC causes initialization.
PWM_A and PWM_B form a complementary PWM pair.
PWM_A and PWM_B outputs are independent PWMs.

BitField.name: SPLIT
BitField.description: Split the DBLPWM signal to PWMA and PWMB

Enum.description: DBLPWM is not split. PWMA and PWMB each have double pulses.
DBLPWM is split to PWMA and PWMB.
PWM clock frequency = fclk
PWM clock frequency = fclk/2
PWM clock frequency = fclk/4
PWM clock frequency = fclk/8
PWM clock frequency = fclk/16
PWM clock frequency = fclk/32
PWM clock frequency = fclk/64
PWM clock frequency = fclk/128

The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to" method. This means that PWM edges are only produced when the counter is equal to one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWMA output that is high at the end of a period will maintain this state until a match with VAL3 clears the output in the following period.

The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to or greater than" method. This means that PWM edges are produced when the counter is equal to or greater than one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWMA output that is high at the end of a period could go low at the start of the next period if the starting counter value is greater than (but not necessarily equal to) the new VAL3 value.
Full-cycle reloads disabled.
Full-cycle reloads enabled.
Half-cycle reloads disabled.
Half-cycle reloads enabled.

Enum.description: DBLPWM is not split. PWMA and PWMB each have double pulses.
DBLPWM is split to PWMA and PWMB.
PWM clock frequency = fclk
PWM clock frequency = fclk/2
PWM clock frequency = fclk/4
PWM clock frequency = fclk/8
PWM clock frequency = fclk/16
PWM clock frequency = fclk/32
PWM clock frequency = fclk/64
PWM clock frequency = fclk/128

The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to" method. This means that PWM edges are only produced when the counter is equal to one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWMA output that is high at the end of a period will maintain this state until a match with VAL3 clears the output in the following period.

The VAL* registers and the PWM counter are compared using an "equal to or greater than" method. This means that PWM edges are produced when the counter is equal to or greater than one of the VAL* register values. This implies that a PWMA output that is high at the end of a period could go low at the start of the next period if the starting counter value is greater than (but not necessarily equal to) the new VAL3 value.
Full-cycle reloads disabled.
Full-cycle reloads enabled.
Half-cycle reloads disabled.
Half-cycle reloads enabled.

Enum.description: Input capture operation is disabled.
Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLA[EDGAx] is enabled.

Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit.

One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is cleared. No further captures will be performed until CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is set again. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLA[ARMA] is then cleared.
Capture falling edges
Capture rising edges
Capture any edge
Capture falling edges
Capture rising edges
Capture any edge
Raw PWM_A input signal selected as source.

Output of edge counter/compare selected as source. When this bitfield is set to 1, the internal edge counter is enabled and the rising and/or falling edges specified by the CAPTCTRLA[EDGA0] and CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields are ignored. The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRA[EDGA0] and/or CAPTCTRLA[EDGA1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture registers.
Edge counter disabled and held in reset
Edge counter enabled

The software must still place a value other than 00 in either or both of the CAPTCTLRB[EDGB0] and/or CAPTCTRLB[EDGB1] fields in order to enable one or both of the capture registers.
Edge counter disabled and held in reset
Edge counter enabled
Input capture operation is disabled.
Input capture operation as specified by CAPTCTRLB[EDGBx] is enabled.

Free running mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and capture circuit 0 is re-armed. The process continues indefinitely. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then captures continue indefinitely on the enabled capture circuit.

One shot mode is selected. If both capture circuits are enabled, then capture circuit 0 is armed first after CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set. Once a capture occurs, capture circuit 0 is disarmed and capture circuit 1 is armed. After capture circuit 1 performs a capture, it is disarmed and CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is cleared. No further captures will be performed until CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is set again. If only one of the capture circuits is enabled, then a single capture will occur on the enabled capture circuit and CAPTCTRLB[ARMB] is then cleared.

Do not load new values.
Load prescaler, modulus, and PWM values of the corresponding submodule.
PWM generator is disabled in the corresponding submodule.
PWM generator is enabled in the corresponding submodule.
PWM23 is used to generate complementary PWM pair in the corresponding submodule.
PWM45 is used to generate complementary PWM pair in the corresponding submodule.
Not locked. Do not monitor PLL operation. Resetting of the fractional delay block in case of PLL losing lock will be controlled by software.
Not locked. Monitor PLL operation to automatically disable the fractional delay block when the PLL encounters problems.
Locked. Do not monitor PLL operation. Resetting of the fractional delay block in case of PLL losing lock will be controlled by software. These bits are write protected until the next reset.
Locked. Monitor PLL operation to automatically disable the fractional delay block when the PLL encounters problems. These bits are write protected until the next reset.
FAULTx CPU interrupt requests disabled.
FAULTx CPU interrupt requests enabled.

Normal mode. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the state of FSTS[FFULL] without regard to the state of FSTS[FFPINx]. The PWM outputs disabled by this fault input will not be re-enabled until the actual FAULTx input signal de-asserts since the fault input will combinationally disable the PWM outputs (as programmed in DISMAPn).
Safe mode. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear and FSTS[FFPINx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the state of FSTS[FFULL].

Manual fault clearing. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending the state of FSTS[FFULL]. This is further controlled by FCTRL[FSAFE].

Automatic fault clearing. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are enabled when FSTS[FFPINx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the state of FSTS[FFULL] without regard to the state of FSTS[FFLAGx].
A logic 0 on the fault input indicates a fault condition.
A logic 1 on the fault input indicates a fault condition.
No fault on the FAULTx pin.
Fault on the FAULTx pin.
PWM outputs are not re-enabled at the start of a full cycle
PWM outputs are re-enabled at the start of a full cycle
PWM outputs are not re-enabled at the start of a half cycle.
PWM outputs are re-enabled at the start of a half cycle (as defined by VAL0).
Fault input glitch stretching is disabled.
Input fault signals will be stretched to at least 2 IPBus clock cycles.
No fault
Cause a simulated fault

BitField.name: NOCOMB
BitField.description: No Combinational Path From Fault Input To PWM Output

Enum.description: There is a combinational link from the fault inputs to the PWM outputs. The fault inputs are combined with the filtered and latched fault signals to disable the PWM outputs.
The direct combinational path from the fault inputs to the PWM outputs is disabled and the filtered and latched fault signals are used to disable the PWM outputs.

Low-Power mode

Normal mode

FIFO mode
In normal mode, 1 word . In FIFO mode, 2 or less than 2 data remaining in FIFO will set watermark status bit.

In normal mode, 3 words . In FIFO mode, Max/2 or less than Max/2 data remaining in FIFO will set watermark status bit.
In normal mode, 4 words . In FIFO mode, Max-2 or less than Max-2 data remaining in FIFO will set watermark status bit.
DMA is disabled.
DMA is enabled. When DMA is enabled, the DMA request will be generated by original interrupts. The interrupts will not be presented on this module at the same time.

Register.name: WDOG_STCTRLH
Register.description: Watchdog Status and Control Register High

BitField.name: WDOGEN
BitField.description: Enables or disables the WDOG's operation

Enum.description: WDOG is disabled.
WDOG is enabled.

BitField.name: CLKSRC
BitField.description: Selects clock source for the WDOG timer and other internal timing operations.

Enum.description: WDOG clock sourced from LPO .
WDOG clock sourced from alternate clock source.

BitField.name: IRQRSTEN
BitField.description: Used to enable the debug breadcrumbs feature

Enum.description: WDOG time-out generates reset only.
WDOG time-out initially generates an interrupt. After WCT, it generates a reset.
Windowing mode is disabled.
Windowing mode is enabled.

BitField.name: ALLOWUPDATE
BitField.description: Enables updates to watchdog write-once registers, after the reset-triggered initial configuration window (WCT) closes, through unlock sequence

Enum.description: No further updates allowed to WDOG write-once registers.
WDOG write-once registers can be unlocked for updating.

BitField.name: DBGEN
BitField.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Debug mode.

Enum.description: WDOG is disabled in CPU Debug mode.
WDOG is enabled in CPU Debug mode.

BitField.name: STOPEN
BitField.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Stop mode.

Enum.description: WDOG is disabled in CPU Stop mode.
WDOG is enabled in CPU Stop mode.

BitField.name: WAITEN
BitField.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Wait mode.

Enum.description: WDOG is disabled in CPU Wait mode.
WDOG is enabled in CPU Wait mode.

BitField.name: TESTWDOG
BitField.description: Puts the watchdog in the functional test mode

BitField.name: TESTSEL
BitField.description: Effective only if TESTWDOG is set. Selects the test to be run on the watchdog timer.

Enum.description: Quick test. The timer runs in normal operation. You can load a small time-out value to do a quick test.

Byte test. Puts the timer in the byte test mode where individual bytes of the timer are enabled for operation and are compared for time-out against the corresponding byte of the programmed time-out value. Select the byte through BYTESEL[1:0] for testing.

BitField.name: BYTESEL
BitField.description: This 2-bit field selects the byte to be tested when the watchdog is in the byte test mode.

Enum.description: Byte 0 selected
Byte 1 selected
Byte 2 selected
Byte 3 selected

BitField.name: DISTESTWDOG
BitField.description: Allows the WDOG's functional test mode to be disabled permanently

Enum.description: WDOG functional test mode is not disabled.
WDOG functional test mode is disabled permanently until reset.

Register.name: WDOG_STCTRLL
Register.description: Watchdog Status and Control Register Low

BitField.name: TOVALHIGH
BitField.description: Defines the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit time-out value for the watchdog timer

BitField.name: TOVALLOW
BitField.description: Defines the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit time-out value for the watchdog timer

BitField.name: WINHIGH
BitField.description: Defines the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit window for the windowed mode of operation of the watchdog

BitField.name: WINLOW
BitField.description: Defines the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit window for the windowed mode of operation of the watchdog

BitField.name: WDOGUNLOCK
BitField.description: Writing the unlock sequence values to this register to makes the watchdog write-once registers writable again

BitField.name: TIMEROUTHIGH
BitField.description: Shows the value of the upper 16 bits of the watchdog timer.

BitField.name: TIMEROUTLOW
BitField.description: Shows the value of the lower 16 bits of the watchdog timer.

BitField.name: RSTCNT
BitField.description: Counts the number of times the watchdog resets the system

BitField.name: PRESCVAL
BitField.description: 3-bit prescaler for the watchdog clock source

Enum.description: Compare interrupt is disabled
Compare interrupt is enabled
No match has occurred
COMP match has occurred
Watchdog timer is disabled
Watchdog timer is enabled
Watchdog timer interrupt is disabled
Watchdog timer interrupt is enabled
No interrupt has occurred
Watchdog timeout interrupt has occurred

BitField.name: XNE
BitField.description: Use Negative Edge of INDEX Pulse

Enum.description: Use positive transition edge of INDEX pulse
Use negative transition edge of INDEX pulse

BitField.name: XIP
BitField.description: INDEX Triggered Initialization of Position Counters UPOS and LPOS

Enum.description: No action
INDEX pulse initializes the position counter
INDEX pulse interrupt is disabled
INDEX pulse interrupt is enabled
No interrupt has occurred
INDEX pulse interrupt has occurred
Use standard quadrature decoder where PHASEA and PHASEB represent a two phase quadrature signal.

Bypass the quadrature decoder. A positive transition of the PHASEA input generates a count signal. The PHASEB input and the REV bit control the counter direction. If CTRL[REV] = 0, PHASEB = 0, then count up If CTRL[REV] = 0, PHASEB = 1, then count down If CTRL[REV] = 1, PHASEB = 0, then count down If CTRL[REV] = 1, PHASEB = 1, then count up
Count normally
Count in the reverse direction

BitField.name: SWIP
BitField.description: Software Triggered Initialization of Position Counters UPOS and LPOS

Enum.description: No action
Initialize position counter

BitField.name: HNE
BitField.description: Use Negative Edge of HOME Input

Enum.description: Use positive going edge-to-trigger initialization of position counters UPOS and LPOS
Use negative going edge-to-trigger initialization of position counters UPOS and LPOS

BitField.name: HIP
BitField.description: Enable HOME to Initialize Position Counters UPOS and LPOS

Enum.description: No action
HOME signal initializes the position counter
Disable HOME interrupts
Enable HOME interrupts
No interrupt
HOME signal transition interrupt request

BitField.name: WDOG
BitField.description: WDOG[15:0] is a binary representation of the number of clock cycles plus one that the watchdog timer counts before timing out and optionally generating an interrupt

BitField.name: POSD
BitField.description: This read/write register contains the position change in value occurring between each read of the position register

BitField.name: POSDH
BitField.description: This read-only register contains a snapshot of the value of the POSD register

BitField.name: REV
BitField.description: This read/write register contains the current value of the revolution counter.

BitField.name: REVH
BitField.description: This read-only register contains a snapshot of the value of the REV register.

BitField.name: POS
BitField.description: This read/write register contains the upper (most significant) half of the position counter

BitField.name: POS
BitField.description: This read/write register contains the lower (least significant) half of the position counter

BitField.name: POSH
BitField.description: This read-only register contains a snapshot of the UPOS register.

BitField.name: POSH
BitField.description: This read-only register contains a snapshot of the LPOS register.

BitField.name: INIT
BitField.description: This read/write register contains the value to be used to initialize the upper half of the position counter (UPOS)

BitField.name: INIT
BitField.description: This read/write register contains the value to be used to initialize the lower half of the position counter (LPOS)

BitField.name: HOME
BitField.description: This is the raw HOME input.

BitField.name: INDEX
BitField.description: This is the raw INDEX input.

BitField.name: PHB
BitField.description: This is the raw PHASEB input.

BitField.name: PHA
BitField.description: This is the raw PHASEA input.

BitField.name: FHOM
BitField.description: This is the filtered version of HOME input.

BitField.name: FIND
BitField.description: This is the filtered version of INDEX input.

BitField.name: FPHB
BitField.description: This is the filtered version of PHASEB input.

BitField.name: FPHA
BitField.description: This is the filtered version of PHASEA input.

BitField.name: TEST_COUNT
BitField.description: These bits hold the number of quadrature advances to generate.

BitField.name: TEST_PERIOD
BitField.description: These bits hold the period of quadrature phase in IPBus clock cycles.

Enum.description: Leaves quadrature decoder signal in a positive direction
Generates a negative quadrature decoder signal
Test count is not enabled
Test count is enabled
Test module is not enabled
Test module is enabled
Disable updates of hold registers on rising edge of TRIGGER
Enable updates of hold registers on rising edge of TRIGGER
No action for POSD, REV, UPOS and LPOS on rising edge of TRIGGER
Clear POSD, REV, UPOS and LPOS on rising edge of TRIGGER
Disable modulo counting
Enable modulo counting
Last count was in the down direction
Last count was in the up direction
Roll-under interrupt is disabled
Roll-under interrupt is enabled
No roll-under has occurred
Roll-under has occurred
Roll-over interrupt is disabled
Roll-over interrupt is enabled
No roll-over has occurred
Roll-over has occurred
Use INDEX pulse to increment/decrement revolution counter (REV).
Use modulus counting roll-over/under to increment/decrement revolution counter (REV).
POSMATCH pulses when a match occurs between the position counters (POS) and the compare value (COMP).
POSMATCH pulses when the UPOS, LPOS, REV, or POSD registers are read.

BitField.name: SABIE
BitField.description: Simultaneous PHASEA and PHASEB Change Interrupt Enable

Enum.description: Simultaneous PHASEA and PHASEB change interrupt disabled.
Simultaneous PHASEA and PHASEB change interrupt enabled.

BitField.name: SABIRQ
BitField.description: Simultaneous PHASEA and PHASEB Change Interrupt Request

Enum.description: No simultaneous change of PHASEA and PHASEB has occurred.
A simultaneous change of PHASEA and PHASEB has occurred.

BitField.name: MOD
BitField.description: This read/write register contains the upper (most significant) half of the modulus register

BitField.name: MOD
BitField.description: This read/write register contains the lower (least significant) half of the modulus register

BitField.name: COMP
BitField.description: This read/write register contains the upper (most significant) half of the position compare register

BitField.name: COMP
BitField.description: This read/write register contains the lower (least significant) half of the position compare register

mul = 1

mul = 4
All DMA signalling disabled.

DMA transfer is enabled. While SMB[FACK] = 0, the following conditions trigger the DMA request: a data byte is received, and either address or data is transmitted. (ACK/NACK is automatic) the first byte received matches the A1 register or is a general call address. If any address matching occurs, S[IAAS] and S[TCF] are set. If the direction of transfer is known from master to slave, then it is not required to check S[SRW]. With this assumption, DMA can also be used in this case. In other cases, if the master reads data from the slave, then it is required to rewrite the C1 register operation. With this assumption, DMA cannot be used. When FACK = 1, an address or a data byte is transmitted.
Normal operation. No interrupt generated when address matching in low power mode.
Enables the wakeup function in low power mode.
An acknowledge signal is sent to the bus on the following receiving byte (if FACK is cleared) or the current receiving byte (if FACK is set).
No acknowledge signal is sent to the bus on the following receiving data byte (if FACK is cleared) or the current receiving data byte (if FACK is set).

No parity error detected since the last time this flag was cleared. If the receive buffer has a depth greater than 1, then there may be data in the receive buffer what was received with a parity error.

Overrun has occurred or the overrun flag has not been cleared since the last overrun occurred.

LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

MSB (bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit, depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit8, bit7, or bit6, depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE].

BitField.name: RT
BitField.description: Reads return the contents of the read-only receive data register and writes go to the write-only transmit data register

Enum.description: The parity bit is the ninth bit in the serial transmission.
The parity bit is the tenth bit in the serial transmission.
All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN1 is cleared.

All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA2 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If a match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer.
All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN2 is cleared.

All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA1 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer.

BitField.name: LBKDDMAS
BitField.description: LIN Break Detect DMA Select Bit

Enum.description: If BDH[LBKDIE] and S2[LBKDIF] are set, the LBKDIF interrupt signal is asserted to request an interrupt service.
If BDH[LBKDIE] and S2[LBKDIF] are set, the LBKDIF DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.
If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] are set, the RDFR interrupt request signal is asserted to request an interrupt service.
If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] are set, the RDRF DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.
If C2[TIE] is set and the S1[TDRE] flag is set, the TDRE interrupt request signal is asserted to request interrupt service.
If C2[TIE] is set and the S1[TDRE] flag is set, the TDRE DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.

BitField.name: PARITYE
BitField.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with a parity error.

Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.
The dataword was received with a parity error.

BitField.name: NOISY
BitField.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with noise.

Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.
The data was received with noise.
CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.
The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit. (FIFO) Ensure that C2[TE] is asserted before assertion of this bit.
Transmitter RTS is active low.
Transmitter RTS is active high.
The receiver has no effect on RTS.

RTS is deasserted if the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is equal to or greater than RWFIFO[RXWATER]. RTS is asserted when the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is less than RWFIFO[RXWATER]. See Hardware flow control

Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.
Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.
Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support).
Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.
RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
RXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
RXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
No flush operation occurs.
All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.
No flush operation occurs.
All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.
No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
No receive buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one receive buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
Receive buffer is not empty.
Receive buffer is empty.
Transmit buffer is not empty.
Transmit buffer is empty.
Data frame consists of a single stop bit.
Data frame consists of two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RxD Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from RXEDGIF disabled using polling.
RXEDGIF interrupt request enabled.

BitField.name: LBKDIE
BitField.description: LIN Break Detect Interrupt or DMA Request Enable

Enum.description: LBKDIF interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled.
LBKDIF interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled.
Even parity.
Odd parity.
Parity function disabled.
Parity function enabled.
Idle character bit count starts after start bit.
Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.
Idle line wakeup.
Address mark wakeup.
Normal-start + 8 data bits (MSB/LSB first as determined by MSBF) + stop.
Use-start + 9 data bits (MSB/LSB first as determined by MSBF) + stop.
Selects internal loop back mode. The receiver input is internally connected to transmitter output.
Single wire UART mode where the receiver input is connected to the transmit pin input signal.
UART clock continues to run in Wait mode.
UART clock freezes while CPU is in Wait mode.
Normal operation.
Loop mode where transmitter output is internally connected to receiver input. The receiver input is determined by RSRC.
Normal transmitter operation.
Queue break characters to be sent.
Normal operation.
RWU enables the wakeup function and inhibits further receiver interrupt requests. Normally, hardware wakes the receiver by automatically clearing RWU.
Receiver off.
Receiver on.
Transmitter off.
Transmitter on.
IDLE interrupt requests disabled.
IDLE interrupt requests enabled.

BitField.name: RIE
BitField.description: Receiver Full Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable

Enum.description: RDRF interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled.
RDRF interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled.
TC interrupt requests disabled.
TC interrupt requests enabled.

BitField.name: TIE
BitField.description: Transmitter Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable.

Enum.description: TDRE interrupt and DMA transfer requests disabled.
TDRE interrupt or DMA transfer requests enabled.

No parity error detected since the last time this flag was cleared. If the receive buffer has a depth greater than 1, then there may be data in the receive buffer what was received with a parity error.
At least one dataword was received with a parity error since the last time this flag was cleared.
No framing error detected.
Framing error.
No noise detected since the last time this flag was cleared. If the receive buffer has a depth greater than 1 then there may be data in the receiver buffer that was received with noise.
At least one dataword was received with noise detected since the last time the flag was cleared.
No overrun has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
Overrun has occurred or the overrun flag has not been cleared since the last overrun occurred.
Receiver input is either active now or has never become active since the IDLE flag was last cleared.
Receiver input has become idle or the flag has not been cleared since it last asserted.
The number of datawords in the receive buffer is less than the number indicated by RXWATER.
The number of datawords in the receive buffer is equal to or greater than the number indicated by RXWATER at some point in time since this flag was last cleared.
Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).
Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).
The amount of data in the transmit buffer is greater than the value indicated by TWFIFO[TXWATER].
The amount of data in the transmit buffer is less than or equal to the value indicated by TWFIFO[TXWATER] at some point in time since the flag has been cleared.
UART receiver idle/inactive waiting for a start bit.
UART receiver active, RxD input not idle.
Break character detection is disabled.
Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times if C1[M] = 0 or 12 bits time if C1[M] = 1.
Break character is 10, 11, or 12 bits long.
Break character is 13 or 14 bits long.
S1[IDLE] is not set upon detection of an idle character.
S1[IDLE] is set upon detection of an idle character.
Receive data is not inverted.
Receive data is inverted.
LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

MSB (bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit, depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit8, bit7, or bit6, depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE].

BitField.name: RXEDGIF
BitField.description: RxD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

Enum.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.
An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.
No LIN break character detected.
LIN break character detected.
PF interrupt requests are disabled.
PF interrupt requests are enabled.
FE interrupt requests are disabled.
FE interrupt requests are enabled.
NF interrupt requests are disabled.
NF interrupt requests are enabled.
OR interrupts are disabled.
OR interrupt requests are enabled.
Transmit data is not inverted.
Transmit data is inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: Transmitter Pin Data Direction in Single-Wire mode

Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single wire mode.
TXD pin is an output in single wire mode.

BitField.name: RT
BitField.description: Reads return the contents of the read-only receive data register and writes go to the write-only transmit data register

Enum.description: The parity bit is the ninth bit in the serial transmission.
The parity bit is the tenth bit in the serial transmission.
All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN1 is cleared.

All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA2 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If a match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer.
All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN2 is cleared.

All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA1 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer.

BitField.name: LBKDDMAS
BitField.description: LIN Break Detect DMA Select Bit

Enum.description: If BDH[LBKDIE] and S2[LBKDIF] are set, the LBKDIF interrupt signal is asserted to request an interrupt service.
If BDH[LBKDIE] and S2[LBKDIF] are set, the LBKDIF DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.
If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] are set, the RDFR interrupt request signal is asserted to request an interrupt service.
If C2[RIE] and S1[RDRF] are set, the RDRF DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.
If C2[TIE] is set and the S1[TDRE] flag is set, the TDRE interrupt request signal is asserted to request interrupt service.
If C2[TIE] is set and the S1[TDRE] flag is set, the TDRE DMA request signal is asserted to request a DMA transfer.

BitField.name: PARITYE
BitField.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with a parity error.

Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.
The dataword was received with a parity error.

BitField.name: NOISY
BitField.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with noise.

Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.
The data was received with noise.
CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.
The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit. (FIFO) Ensure that C2[TE] is asserted before assertion of this bit.
Transmitter RTS is active low.
Transmitter RTS is active high.
The receiver has no effect on RTS.

RTS is deasserted if the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is equal to or greater than RWFIFO[RXWATER]. RTS is asserted when the number of characters in the receiver data register (FIFO) is less than RWFIFO[RXWATER]. See Hardware flow control

RegisterGroup.name: CMP0
RegisterGroup.description: High-Speed Comparator (CMP), Voltage Reference (VREF) Digital-to-Analog Converter (DAC), and Analog Mux (ANMUX)

Enum.description: Level 0
Level 1
Level 2
Level 3
Filter is disabled. If SE = 1, then COUT is a logic 0. This is not a legal state, and is not recommended. If SE = 0, COUT = COUTA.
One sample must agree. The comparator output is simply sampled.
2 consecutive samples must agree.
3 consecutive samples must agree.
4 consecutive samples must agree.
5 consecutive samples must agree.
6 consecutive samples must agree.
7 consecutive samples must agree.
Analog Comparator is disabled.
Analog Comparator is enabled.
CMPO is not available on the associated CMPO output pin. If the comparator does not own the pin, this field has no effect.

CMPO is available on the associated CMPO output pin. The comparator output (CMPO) is driven out on the associated CMPO output pin if the comparator owns the pin. If the comparator does not own the field, this bit has no effect.
Set the filtered comparator output (CMPO) to equal COUT.
Set the unfiltered comparator output (CMPO) to equal COUTA.
Does not invert the comparator output.
Inverts the comparator output.
Low-Speed (LS) Comparison mode selected. In this mode, CMP has slower output propagation delay and lower current consumption.
High-Speed (HS) Comparison mode selected. In this mode, CMP has faster output propagation delay and higher current consumption.
Trigger mode is disabled.
Trigger mode is enabled.
Windowing mode is not selected.
Windowing mode is selected.
Sampling mode is not selected.
Sampling mode is selected.
Falling-edge on COUT has not been detected.
Falling-edge on COUT has occurred.
Rising-edge on COUT has not been detected.
Rising-edge on COUT has occurred.
Interrupt is disabled.
Interrupt is enabled.
Interrupt is disabled.
Interrupt is enabled.
DMA is disabled.
DMA is enabled.
Vin1 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference.
Vin2 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference.
DAC is disabled.
DAC is enabled.

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: Disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses.

Enum.description: there are preempted active exceptions to execute
there are no active exceptions, or the currently-executing exception is the only active exception

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Enum.description: Will not service
Will service a pending exception
no effect
removes the pending state from the SysTick exception
write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending
write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending
no effect
removes the pending state from the PendSV exception
write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending
write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending
write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending
write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

Register.name: SCB_AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

Enum.description: no system reset request
asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

BitField.name: PRIGROUP
BitField.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority.

Enum.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode
enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR
deep sleep
only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded
enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor
processor can enter Thread mode only when no exception is active
processor can enter Thread mode from any level under the control of an EXC_RETURN value

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

Enum.description: do not trap unaligned halfword and word accesses
trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

Enum.description: do not trap divide by 0
trap divide by 0

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN

BitField.name: AUXFAULT
BitField.description: Latched version of the AUXFAULT inputs

Enum.description: Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault
Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP fault.
Reserved. The result of any access is UNPREDICTABLE.
Full access.
Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault
Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP fault.
Reserved. The result of any access is UNPREDICTABLE.
Full access.
Lazy state preservation is not active.
Lazy state preservation is active. floating-point stack frame has been allocated but saving state to it has been deferred.

BitField.name: USER
BitField.description: Privilege level when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: Privilege level was not user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
Privilege level was user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: THREAD
BitField.description: Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: Mode was not Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
Mode was Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: HFRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: Priority did not permit setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
Priority permitted setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: MMRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: MemManage is disabled or priority did not permit setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
MemManage is enabled and priority permitted setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: BFRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: MONRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.description: DebugMonitor is disabled or priority did not permit setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.
DebugMonitor is enabled and priority permits setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: LSPEN
BitField.description: Lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

Enum.description: Disable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context.
Enable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

BitField.name: ASPEN
BitField.description: Enables CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction. This results in automatic hardware state preservation and restoration, for floating-point context, on exception entry and exit.

Enum.description: Disable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction.
Enable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction.

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame.

BitField.name: RMode
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.RMode (Rounding Mode control field).

Enum.description: Round to Nearest (RN) mode
Round towards Plus Infinity (RP) mode.
Round towards Minus Infinity (RM) mode.
Round towards Zero (RZ) mode.

BitField.name: FZ
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.FZ (Flush-to-zero mode control bit).

Enum.description: Flush-to-zero mode disabled. Behavior of the floating-point system is fully compliant with the IEEE 754 standard.
Flush-to-zero mode enabled.

BitField.name: DN
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.DN (Default NaN mode control bit).

Enum.description: NaN operands propagate through to the output of a floating-point operation.
Any operation involving one or more NaNs returns the Default NaN.

BitField.name: AHP
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.AHP (Alternative half-precision control bit).

Enum.description: IEEE half-precision format selected.
Alternative half-precision format selected.

counting down to 0 asserts the SysTick exception request

BitField.name: CURRENT

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is present

BitField.name: AMC
BitField.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.

A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is present

BitField.description: The total number of interrupt lines supported by an implementation, defined in groups of 32.

BitField.description: Disables floating pointinstructions completing outof order with respect to integer instructions

BitField.description: When set to 1, disables IT folding

BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF

BitField.description: When set to 1, disables interruption of load multiple and store multiple instructions

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

BitField.name: RETTOBASE
BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND

BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.name: MMARVALID
BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register(MMFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: MLSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: MSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: MUNSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: LSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: STKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: UNSTKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: INVPC
BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

BitField.name: FORCED
BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled

BitField.name: VECTTBL
BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault

BitField.name: IMPDEF
BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals

BitField.name: ADDRESSS
BitField.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame
